circumstances: Tony Evans, a 90-year-old male, went missing from a pharmacy located at 2 Cross Street, Scone. Concern arose when he failed to return to his home on Craigieknowes Road, Perth, and missed his regular grocery shopping at 22 The Square. Tony, who had a history of living off-grid, was last seen near Moray Street, Blackford, and did not collect his scheduled medication. His friend, Mohamed Norris, mentioned Tony often spoke of wanting solitude, raising further concern among friends and family. After several days of searching, Tony was found safe by police at Roy Bridge Road, Spean Bridge. circumstances: Tony Evans, a 92-year-old man with a disability, went missing from his home on Craigieknowes Road, Perth. Known to occasionally wander due to memory issues, Tony was last seen near an adult day care on Hospital Street, Perth, which he visited frequently. After failing to return home, his family, including his daughter and son, Francis Daniels, grew concerned. Investigators received reports from a colleague, Anna Davies, that Tony was spotted near an abandoned building in gang territory. His absence prompted a search through the sewers, frequently used as shortcuts by locals. After days of searching, police found Tony safe at North Bank Dykes, Errol.
